item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wen/#comment-138">Lacey</a>.
Because I'm licensed, I shop at the pro stores, but I might still be out of luck. I didn't get the chance to go look yesterday.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lacey.

Because I’m licensed, I shop at the pro stores, but I might still be out of luck. I didn’t get the chance to go look yesterday.

item.title: By: Lacey
item.dc:creator: Lacey
item.description: You may have to order it online I have yet to find it here! If you find it let me know what you think
item.content:encoded: You may have to order it online I have yet to find it here! If you find it let me know what you think

item.title: By: Liz
item.dc:creator: Liz
item.description: I've been using Lush Fair Trade Honey Shampoo and I love it. I use R&B for a leave in conditioner but have yet to find a conditioner for the shower I absolutely love.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been using Lush Fair Trade Honey Shampoo and I love it. I use R&B for a leave in conditioner but have yet to find a conditioner for the shower I absolutely love.

item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wen/#comment-134">Lacey</a>.
I've heard about that line, but I never think to look for it at the beauty supply. Maybe I'll swing by there today. I do always use color repair, you're right about that. All those salon brands are usually fine for color though, so I'm going to start branching out. Good comment, Lace!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lacey.

I’ve heard about that line, but I never think to look for it at the beauty supply. Maybe I’ll swing by there today. I do always use color repair, you’re right about that. All those salon brands are usually fine for color though, so I’m going to start branching out. Good comment, Lace!

item.title: By: Lacey
item.dc:creator: Lacey
item.description: Oh my goodness where to start!! First so glad to know wen is no miracle I too watched the commercials and thought I need it, but tv stuff hardly ever works so I didn't do it. However a hairdresser friend of mine who's worked in all kinds of top salons in LA and San Diego gave me the best bday gift of my life one I never even new was this amazing fabulous brand of hair product!!!! And don't be fooled that its a buy loreal it's there high end line K'erastase, I have the green shampoo bottle K'erastase resistance, and the conditioner K'erastase nutritive it's in an orange container that looks as if its a lotion or something but you leave it in for two minutes or so and rinse and your hair slippery and smooth, the after products you use make a big difference too as far as texture and the ability to work with it my hair can be fine and to soft and weightless so I use not only a root boost but a thickens moose at the roots and this nutrition cream from the same line on the ends then I finish with a shine cream anyhoo after all that my point is you guys may need to find product or shampoos that do different things a lot of time people think oooo color damage repair that's the one I need when that gives me the worst texture for Aron I'd say try a sleek n shine one and put in an after product that does the same I hope some of this helped its much easier said in person lol sorry for the long post hope it made a little bit of sense oh and on Those K'erastase products a little goes a long way I love that too! Good luck girls, oh and if any blondes read this every other time I shampoo I use a toning shampoo to get my blonde looking like new after all that yellow it begins to get after hair spray and product couldn't live without it!
item.content:encoded: Oh my goodness where to start!! First so glad to know wen is no miracle I too watched the commercials and thought I need it, but tv stuff hardly ever works so I didn’t do it. However a hairdresser friend of mine who’s worked in all kinds of top salons in LA and San Diego gave me the best bday gift of my life one I never even new was this amazing fabulous brand of hair product!!!! And don’t be fooled that its a buy loreal it’s there high end line K’erastase, I have the green shampoo bottle K’erastase resistance, and the conditioner K’erastase nutritive it’s in an orange container that looks as if its a lotion or something but you leave it in for two minutes or so and rinse and your hair slippery and smooth, the after products you use make a big difference too as far as texture and the ability to work with it my hair can be fine and to soft and weightless so I use not only a root boost but a thickens moose at the roots and this nutrition cream from the same line on the ends then I finish with a shine cream anyhoo after all that my point is you guys may need to find product or shampoos that do different things a lot of time people think oooo color damage repair that’s the one I need when that gives me the worst texture for Aron I’d say try a sleek n shine one and put in an after product that does the same I hope some of this helped its much easier said in person lol sorry for the long post hope it made a little bit of sense oh and on Those K’erastase products a little goes a long way I love that too! Good luck girls, oh and if any blondes read this every other time I shampoo I use a toning shampoo to get my blonde looking like new after all that yellow it begins to get after hair spray and product couldn’t live without it!
